   22: -module(ssh_protocol_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("kernel/include/inet.hrl").
   26: -include("ssh.hrl").		% ?UINT32, ?BYTE, #ssh{} ...
   27: -include("ssh_transport.hrl").
   28: -include("ssh_auth.hrl").
   29: -include("ssh_test_lib.hrl").
   30: 
   31: -export([
   32:          suite/0,
   33:          all/0,
   34:          groups/0,
   35:          init_per_suite/1,
   36:          end_per_suite/1,
   37:          init_per_testcase/2,
   38:          end_per_testcase/2
   39:         ]).
   40: 
   41: -export([
   42:          bad_long_service_name/1,
   43:          bad_packet_length/2,
   44:          bad_service_name/1,
   45:          bad_service_name/2,
   46:          bad_service_name_length/2,
   47:          bad_service_name_then_correct/1,
   48:          bad_very_long_service_name/1,
   49:          client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds/1,
   50:          client_info_line/1,
   51:          do_gex_client_init/3,
   52:          do_gex_client_init_old/3,
   53:          empty_service_name/1,
   54:          ext_info_c/1,
   55:          ext_info_s/1,
   56:          gex_client_init_option_groups/1,
   57:          gex_client_init_option_groups_file/1,
   58:          gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file/1,
   59:          gex_client_old_request_exact/1,
   60:          gex_client_old_request_noexact/1,
   61:          gex_server_gex_limit/1,
   62:          lib_match/1,
   63:          lib_no_match/1,
   64:          lib_works_as_client/1,
   65:          lib_works_as_server/1,
   66:          modify_append/1,
   67:          modify_combo/1,
   68:          modify_prepend/1,
   69:          modify_rm/1,
   70:          no_common_alg_client_disconnects/1,
   71:          no_common_alg_server_disconnects/1,
   72:          no_ext_info_s1/1,
   73:          no_ext_info_s2/1,
   74:          packet_length_too_large/1,
   75:          packet_length_too_short/1,
   76:          preferred_algorithms/1,
   77:          service_name_length_too_large/1,
   78:          service_name_length_too_short/1,
   79:          client_close_after_hello/1
   80:         ]).
   81: 
   82: -define(NEWLINE, <<"\r\n">>).
   83: -define(REKEY_DATA_TMO, 65000).
   84: 
   85: -define(DEFAULT_KEX, 'diffie-hellman-group14-sha256').
   86: -define(EXTRA_KEX, 'diffie-hellman-group1-sha1').
   87: 
   88: -define(CIPHERS, ['aes256-ctr','aes192-ctr','aes128-ctr','aes128-cbc','3des-cbc']).
   89: -define(DEFAULT_CIPHERS, (fun() -> Ciphs = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
   90:                                    [{client2server,Ciphs}, {server2client,Ciphs}]
   91:                           end)()
   92:         ).
   93: 
   94: 
   95: -define(v(Key, Config), proplists:get_value(Key, Config)).
   96: -define(v(Key, Config, Default), proplists:get_value(Key, Config, Default)).
   97: 
   98: 
   99: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  100: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  101: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  102: 
  103: suite() ->
  104:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  105:      {timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  106: 
  107: all() -> 
  108:     [{group,tool_tests},
  109:      client_info_line,
  110:      {group,kex},
  111:      {group,service_requests},
  112:      {group,authentication},
  113:      {group,packet_size_error},
  114:      {group,field_size_error},
  115:      {group,ext_info},
  116:      {group,preferred_algorithms},
  117:      {group,client_close_early}
  118:     ].
  119: 
  120: groups() ->
  121:     [{tool_tests, [], [lib_works_as_client,
  122: 		       lib_works_as_server,
  123: 		       lib_match,
  124: 		       lib_no_match
  125: 		      ]},
  126:      {packet_size_error, [], [packet_length_too_large,
  127: 			      packet_length_too_short]},
  128:       
  129:      {field_size_error, [], [service_name_length_too_large,
  130: 			     service_name_length_too_short]},
  131:       
  132:      {kex, [], [no_common_alg_server_disconnects,
  133: 		no_common_alg_client_disconnects,
  134: 		gex_client_init_option_groups,
  135: 		gex_server_gex_limit,
  136: 		gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file,
  137: 		gex_client_init_option_groups_file,
  138: 		gex_client_old_request_exact,
  139: 		gex_client_old_request_noexact
  140: 		]},
  141:      {service_requests, [], [bad_service_name,
  142: 			     bad_long_service_name,
  143: 			     bad_very_long_service_name,
  144: 			     empty_service_name,
  145: 			     bad_service_name_then_correct
  146: 			    ]},
  147:      {authentication, [], [client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds
  148: 			  ]},
  149:      {ext_info, [], [no_ext_info_s1,
  150:                      no_ext_info_s2,
  151:                      ext_info_s,
  152:                      ext_info_c
  153:                     ]},
  154:      {preferred_algorithms, [], [preferred_algorithms,
  155:                                  modify_append,
  156:                                  modify_prepend,
  157:                                  modify_rm,
  158:                                  modify_combo
  159:                                 ]},
  160:      {client_close_early, [], [client_close_after_hello
  161:                                ]}
  162:     ].
  163: 
  164: 
  165: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  166:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(start_std_daemon( setup_dirs( start_apps(Config)))).
  167:     
  168: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  169:     stop_apps(Config).
  170: 
  171: 
  172: 
  173: init_per_testcase(no_common_alg_server_disconnects, Config) ->
  174:     start_std_daemon(Config, [{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-rsa']},
  175:                                                      {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  176:                                                     ]}]);
  177: 
  178: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == gex_client_init_option_groups ;
  179: 				   TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ;
  180: 				   TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_file ;
  181: 				   TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  182: 				   TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  183: 				   TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  184:     Opts = case TC of
  185: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups ->
  186: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, 
  187:                      [{1023, 5, 
  188:                        16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A770E2EC9F
  189:                       }]}];
  190: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups_file ->
  191: 		   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  192: 		   F = filename:join(DataDir, "dh_group_test"),
  193: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, {file,F}}];
  194: 	       gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ->
  195: 		   DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  196: 		   F = filename:join(DataDir, "dh_group_test.moduli"),
  197: 		   [{dh_gex_groups, {ssh_moduli_file,F}}];
  198: 	       _ when TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  199: 		      TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  200: 		      TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  201: 		    [{dh_gex_groups, 
  202:                       [{1023, 2, 16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A771225323},
  203:                        {1535, 5, 16#D1391174233D315398FE2830AC6B2B66BCCD01B0A634899F339B7879F1DB85712E9DC4E4B1C6C8355570C1D2DCB53493DF18175A9C53D1128B592B4C72D97136F5542FEB981CBFE8012FDD30361F288A42BD5EBB08BAB0A5640E1AC48763B2ABD1945FEE36B2D55E1D50A1C86CED9DD141C4E7BE2D32D9B562A0F8E2E927020E91F58B57EB9ACDDA106A59302D7E92AD5F6E851A45FA1CFE86029A0F727F65A8F475F33572E2FDAB6073F0C21B8B54C3823DB2EF068927E5D747498F96E1E827},
  204:                        {3071, 2, 16#DFAA35D35531E0F524F0099877A482D2AC8D589F374394A262A8E81A8A4FB2F65FADBAB395E05D147B29D486DFAA41F41597A256DA82A8B6F76401AED53D0253F956CEC610D417E42E3B287F7938FC24D8821B40BFA218A956EB7401BED6C96C68C7FD64F8170A8A76B953DD2F05420118F6B144D8FE48060A2BCB85056B478EDEF96DBC70427053ECD2958C074169E9550DD877779A3CF17C5AC850598C7586BEEA9DCFE9DD2A5FB62DF5F33EA7BC00CDA31B9D2DD721F979EA85B6E63F0C4E30BDDCD3A335522F9004C4ED50B15DC537F55324DD4FA119FB3F101467C6D7E1699DE4B3E3C478A8679B8EB3FA5C9B826B44530FD3BE9AD3063B240B0C853EBDDBD68DD940332D98F148D5D9E1DC977D60A0D23D0CA1198637FEAE4E7FAAC173AF2B84313A666CFB4EE6972811921D0AD867CE57F3BBC8D6CB057E3B66757BB46C9F72662624D44E14528327E3A7100E81A12C43C4E236118318CD90C8AA185BBB0C764826DAEAEE8DD245C5B451B4944E6122CC522D1C335C2EEF9429825A2B}
  205:                       ]},
  206:                      {dh_gex_limits, {1023,2000}}
  207: 		    ];
  208: 	       _ ->
  209: 		   []
  210: 	   end,
  211:     start_std_daemon(Config,
  212: 		     [{preferred_algorithms,[{cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  213:                                             ]}
  214: 		      | Opts]);
  215: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  216:     check_std_daemon_works(Config, ?LINE).
  217: 
  218: end_per_testcase(no_common_alg_server_disconnects, Config) ->
  219:     stop_std_daemon(Config);
  220: end_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC == gex_client_init_option_groups ;
  221: 				  TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_moduli_file ;
  222: 				  TC == gex_client_init_option_groups_file ;
  223: 				  TC == gex_server_gex_limit ;
  224: 				  TC == gex_client_old_request_exact ;
  225: 				  TC == gex_client_old_request_noexact ->
  226:     stop_std_daemon(Config);
  227: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  228:     check_std_daemon_works(Config, ?LINE).
  229: 
  230: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  231: %%% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  232: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  233: 
  234: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  235: %%% Connect to an erlang server and check that the testlib acts as a client.
  236: lib_works_as_client(Config) ->
  237:     %% Connect and negotiate keys
  238:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  239: 			  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]}]
  240: 			 ),
  241:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex(Config, InitialState),
  242: 
  243:     %% Do the authentcation
  244:     {User,Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  245:     {ok,EndState} =
  246: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  247: 	  [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  248: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  249: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{user = User,
  250: 					    service = "ssh-connection",
  251: 					    method = "password",
  252: 					    data = <<?BOOLEAN(?FALSE),
  253: 						     ?STRING(unicode:characters_to_binary(Pwd))>>
  254: 					   }},
  255: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  256: 	  ], AfterKexState),
  257: 
  258:     %% Disconnect
  259:     {ok,_} =
  260: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  261: 	  [{send, #ssh_msg_disconnect{code = ?SSH_DISCONNECT_BY_APPLICATION,
  262: 				      description = "End of the fun",
  263: 				      language = ""
  264: 				     }},
  265: 	   close_socket
  266: 	  ], EndState).
  267: 
  268: 
  269: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  270: %%% Connect an erlang client and check that the testlib can act as a server.
  271: lib_works_as_server(Config) ->
  272:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  273: 
  274:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  275:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  276:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  277: 
  278:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  279:     spawn_link(
  280:       fun() ->
  281: 	      {ok,_} =
  282: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  283: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  284: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  285: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  286: 		     receive_hello,
  287: 		     {send, hello},
  288: 
  289: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  290: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  291: 
  292: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  293: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  294: 
  295: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  296: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  297: 
  298: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  299: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  300: 
  301: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  302: 						       method="none",
  303: 						       user=User,
  304: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  305: 
  306: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "password",
  307: 						      partial_success = false}},
  308: 
  309: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  310: 						       method="password",
  311: 						       user=User,
  312: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  313: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  314: 		     close_socket,
  315: 		     print_state
  316: 		    ],
  317: 		    InitialState)
  318:       end),
  319: 
  320:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  321:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  322: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  323:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  324:                                                 ]}
  325:                          ]
  326: 			).
  327: 
  328: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  329: %%% Matching
  330: lib_match(_Config) ->
  331:     {ok,_} =
  332: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([{set_options, [print_ops]},
  333: 				{match, abc, abc},
  334: 				{match, '$a', {cde,fgh}},
  335: 				{match, {cde,fgh}, '$a'},
  336: 				{match, '_', {cde,fgh}},
  337: 				{match, [a,'$a',b], [a,{cde,fgh},b]},
  338: 				{match, [a,'$a'|'$b'], [a,{cde,fgh},b,c]},
  339: 				{match, '$b', [b,c]}
  340: 			       ]).
  341: 
  342: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  343: %%% Not matching
  344: lib_no_match(_Config) ->
  345:     case ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([{set_options, [print_ops]},
  346: 				 {match, '$x', b},
  347: 				 {match, a, '$x'}])
  348:     of
  349: 	{ok,_} -> {fail,"Unexpected match"};
  350: 	{error, {_Op,{expected,a,b},_State}} -> ok
  351:     end.
  352: 
  353: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  354: %%% Algo negotiation fail.  This should result in a ssh_msg_disconnect
  355: %%% being sent from the server.
  356: no_common_alg_server_disconnects(Config) ->
  357:     {ok,_} =
  358: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  359: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  360: 	   {connect,
  361: 	    server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
  362: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  363: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  364: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  365: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-dss']},
  366:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  367:                                    ]}
  368: 	    ]},
  369: 	   receive_hello,
  370: 	   {send, hello},
  371: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  372: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},  % with server unsupported 'ssh-dss' !
  373: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  374: 	  ]
  375: 	 ).
  376: 
  377: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  378: %%% Algo negotiation fail.  This should result in a ssh_msg_disconnect
  379: %%% being sent from the client.
  380: no_common_alg_client_disconnects(Config) ->
  381:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  382:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  383:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  384:     Parent = self(),
  385: 
  386:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  387:     Pid =
  388: 	spawn_link(
  389: 	  fun() ->
  390: 		  Parent !
  391: 		      {result,self(),
  392: 		       ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  393: 			 [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  394: 			  {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  395: 				    {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  396: 			  receive_hello,
  397: 			  {send, hello},
  398: 			  {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  399: 			  {send,  #ssh_msg_kexinit{ % with unsupported "SOME-UNSUPPORTED"
  400: 				     cookie = <<80,158,95,51,174,35,73,130,246,141,200,49,180,190,82,234>>,
  401: 				     kex_algorithms = [atom_to_list(?DEFAULT_KEX)],
  402: 				     server_host_key_algorithms = ["SOME-UNSUPPORTED"],  % SIC!
  403: 				     encryption_algorithms_client_to_server = ["aes128-ctr"],
  404: 				     encryption_algorithms_server_to_client = ["aes128-ctr"],
  405: 				     mac_algorithms_client_to_server = ["hmac-sha2-256"],
  406: 				     mac_algorithms_server_to_client = ["hmac-sha2-256"],
  407: 				     compression_algorithms_client_to_server = ["none"],
  408: 				     compression_algorithms_server_to_client = ["none"],
  409: 				     languages_client_to_server = [],
  410: 				     languages_server_to_client = [],
  411: 				     first_kex_packet_follows = false,
  412: 				     reserved = 0
  413: 				    }},
  414: 			  {match, disconnect(?SSH_DISCONNECT_KEY_EXCHANGE_FAILED), receive_msg}
  415: 			 ],
  416: 			 InitialState)
  417: 		      }
  418: 	  end),
  419: 
  420:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client
  421:     %% which of course does not support SOME-UNSUPPORTED as pub key algo:
  422:     Result = std_connect(HostPort, Config, [{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-dss']},
  423:                                                                    {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  424:                                                                   ]}]),
  425:     ct:log("Result of connect is ~p",[Result]),
  426: 
  427:     receive
  428: 	{result,Pid,{ok,_}} -> 
  429: 	    ok;
  430: 	{result,Pid,{error,{Op,ExecResult,S}}} ->
  431: 	    ct:log("ERROR!~nOp = ~p~nExecResult = ~p~nState =~n~s",
  432: 		   [Op,ExecResult,ssh_trpt_test_lib:format_msg(S)]),
  433: 	    {fail, ExecResult};
  434: 	X -> 
  435: 	    ct:log("¤¤¤¤¤"),
  436: 	    ct:fail(X)
  437:     after 
  438: 	30000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  439:     end.
  440: 
  441: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  442: gex_client_init_option_groups(Config) ->
  443:     do_gex_client_init(Config, {512, 2048, 4000},
  444: 		       {5,16#D9277DAA27DB131C03B108D41A76B4DA8ACEECCCAE73D2E48CEDAAA70B09EF9F04FB020DCF36C51B8E485B26FABE0337E24232BE4F4E693548310244937433FB1A5758195DC73B84ADEF8237472C46747D79DC0A2CF8A57CE8DBD8F466A20F8551E7B1B824B2E4987A8816D9BC0741C2798F3EBAD3ADEBCC78FCE6A770E2EC9F}
  445:                       ).
  446: 
  447: gex_client_init_option_groups_file(Config) ->

  457: gex_server_gex_limit(Config) ->

  461:                        ).

  463: 
  464: do_gex_client_init(Config, {Min,N,Max}, {G,P}) ->
  465:     {ok,_} =
  466: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  467: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  468: 	   {connect,
  469: 	    server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
  470: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  471: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  472: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  473: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,['diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256']},
  474:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  475:                                    ]}
  476: 	    ]},
  477: 	   receive_hello,
  478: 	   {send, hello},
  479: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  480: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  481: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_request{min = Min, 
  482: 					      n = N,
  483: 					      max = Max}},
  484: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_group{p=P, g=G, _='_'},  receive_msg}
  485: 	  ]
  486: 	 ).
  487: 
  488: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------

  492:                            ).

  497:                            ).

  499: do_gex_client_init_old(Config, N, {G,P}) ->
  500:     {ok,_} =
  501: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  502: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  503: 	   {connect,
  504: 	    server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
  505: 	    [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  506: 	     {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  507: 	     {user_interaction, false},
  508: 	     {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,['diffie-hellman-group-exchange-sha256']},
  509:                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  510:                                    ]}
  511: 	    ]},
  512: 	   receive_hello,
  513: 	   {send, hello},
  514: 	   {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  515: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  516: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_kex_dh_gex_request_old{n = N}},

  521: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  522: bad_service_name(Config) -> 
  523:     bad_service_name(Config, "kfglkjf").
  524:     
  525: bad_long_service_name(Config) -> 
  526:     bad_service_name(Config, 
  527: 		     lists:duplicate(?SSH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE div 2, $a)).
  528: 
  529: bad_very_long_service_name(Config) -> 
  530:     bad_service_name(Config,
  531: 		     lists:duplicate(?SSH_MAX_PACKET_SIZE+5, $a)).
  532: 
  533: empty_service_name(Config) ->
  534:     bad_service_name(Config, "").
  535:     
  536: bad_service_name_then_correct(Config) ->
  537:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  538:     {ok,_} =
  539: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  540: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  541: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "kdjglkfdjgkldfjglkdfjglkfdjglkj"}},
  542: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-connection"}},
  543: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  544: 	   ], InitialState).
  545: 
  546: 
  547: bad_service_name(Config, Name) ->
  548:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  549:     {ok,_} =
  550: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  551: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  552: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = Name}},
  553: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  554: 	  ], InitialState).
  555: 
  556: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  557: packet_length_too_large(Config) -> bad_packet_length(Config, +4).
  558: 
  559: packet_length_too_short(Config) -> bad_packet_length(Config, -4).
  560:     
  561: bad_packet_length(Config, LengthExcess) ->
  562:     PacketFun = 
  563: 	fun(Msg, Ssh) ->
  564: 		BinMsg = ssh_message:encode(Msg),
  565: 		ssh_transport:pack(BinMsg, Ssh, LengthExcess)
  566: 	end,
  567:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  568:     {ok,_} =
  569: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  570: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  571: 	   {send, {special,
  572: 		   #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"},
  573: 		   PacketFun}},
  574: 	   %% Prohibit remote decoder starvation:	   
  575: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  576: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  577: 	  ], InitialState).
  578: 
  579: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  580: service_name_length_too_large(Config) -> bad_service_name_length(Config, +4).
  581: 
  582: service_name_length_too_short(Config) -> bad_service_name_length(Config, -4).
  583: 
  584: 
  585: bad_service_name_length(Config, LengthExcess) ->
  586:     PacketFun = 
  587: 	fun(#ssh_msg_service_request{name=Service}, Ssh) ->
  588: 		BinName = list_to_binary(Service),
  589: 		BinMsg = 
  590: 		    <<?BYTE(?SSH_MSG_SERVICE_REQUEST),
  591: 		      %% A bad string encoding of Service:
  592: 		      ?UINT32(size(BinName)+LengthExcess), BinName/binary
  593: 		    >>,
  594: 		ssh_transport:pack(BinMsg, Ssh)
  595: 	end,
  596:     {ok,InitialState} = connect_and_kex(Config),
  597:     {ok,_} =
  598: 	ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  599: 	  [{set_options, [print_ops, print_seqnums, print_messages]},
  600: 	   {send, {special,
  601: 		   #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, 
  602: 		   PacketFun} },
  603: 	   %% Prohibit remote decoder starvation:	   
  604: 	   {send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  605: 	   {match, disconnect(), receive_msg}
  606: 	  ], InitialState).
  607:     
  608: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  609: %%% This is due to a fault report (OTP-13255) with OpenSSH-6.6.1
  610: client_handles_keyboard_interactive_0_pwds(Config) ->
  611:     {User,_Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
  612: 
  613:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  614:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  615:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  616: 
  617:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  618:     spawn_link(
  619:       fun() ->
  620: 	      {ok,_} =
  621: 		  ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  622: 		    [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  623: 		     {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  624: 			       {user_dir, user_dir(Config)}]},
  625: 		     receive_hello,
  626: 		     {send, hello},
  627: 
  628: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  629: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  630: 
  631: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  632: 		     {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  633: 
  634: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  635: 		     {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  636: 
  637: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_service_request{name="ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg},
  638: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name="ssh-userauth"}},
  639: 
  640: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  641: 						       method="none",
  642: 						       user=User,
  643: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  644: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_failure{authentications = "keyboard-interactive",
  645: 						      partial_success = false}},
  646: 		     
  647: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_request{service="ssh-connection",
  648: 						       method="keyboard-interactive",
  649: 						       user=User,
  650: 						       _='_'}, receive_msg},
  651: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  652: 							   instruction = "",
  653: 							   language_tag = "",
  654: 							   num_prompts = 1,
  655: 							   data = <<0,0,0,10,80,97,115,115,119,111,114,100,58,32,0>>
  656: 							  }},
  657: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 1,
  658: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  659: 		      
  660: 		     %% the next is strange, but openssh 6.6.1 does this and this is what this testcase is about
  661: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_request{name = "",
  662: 							   instruction = "",
  663: 							   language_tag = "",
  664: 							   num_prompts = 0,
  665: 							   data = <<>>
  666: 							  }},
  667: 		     {match, #ssh_msg_userauth_info_response{num_responses = 0,
  668: 							     data = <<>>,
  669: 							     _='_'}, receive_msg},
  670: 		     %% Here we know that the tested fault is fixed
  671: 		     {send, #ssh_msg_userauth_success{}},
  672: 		     close_socket,
  673: 		     print_state
  674: 		    ],
  675: 		    InitialState)
  676:       end),
  677: 
  678:     %% and finally connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client:
  679:     {ok,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  680: 			 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  681:                                                  {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  682:                                                 ]}]
  683: 			).
  684: 
  685: 
  686: 
  687: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  688: client_info_line(Config) ->
  689:     %% A client must not send an info-line. If it does, the server should handle
  690:     %% handle this gracefully
  691:     {ok,Pid} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:add_report_handler(),
  692:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  693:     {_, _, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir,DataDir}]),
  694: 
  695:     %% Fake client:
  696:     {ok,S} = gen_tcp:connect("localhost",Port,[]),
  697:     gen_tcp:send(S,"An illegal info-string\r\n"),
  698:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  699: 
  700:     %% wait for server to react:
  701:     timer:sleep(1000),
  702: 
  703:     %% check if a badmatch was received:
  704:     {ok, Reports} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:get_reports(Pid),
  705:     case lists:any(fun({error_report,_,{_,supervisor_report,L}}) when is_list(L) -> 
  706: 			   lists:member({reason,{badmatch,{error,closed}}}, L);
  707: 		      (_) ->
  708: 			   false
  709: 		   end, Reports) of
  710: 	true ->
  711: 	    ct:fail("Bad error report on info_line from client");
  712: 	false ->
  713: 	    ok
  714:     end.
  715: 	
  716: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  717: %%% The server does not send the extension because
  718: %%% the client does not tell the server to send it
  719: no_ext_info_s1(Config) ->
  720:     %% Start the daemon
  721:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,true},
  722:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  723:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{server,Server}|Config]),
  724:     {ok,_} = 
  725:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  726:           [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  727: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg}
  728:           ], AfterKexState),
  729:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  730: 
  731: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  732: %%% The server does not send the extension because
  733: %%% the server is not configured to send it
  734: no_ext_info_s2(Config) ->    
  735:     %% Start the daemon
  736:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,false},
  737:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  738:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{extra_options,[{recv_ext_info,true}]},
  739:                                           {server,Server}
  740:                                           | Config]),
  741:     {ok,_} =
  742:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  743:           [{send, #ssh_msg_service_request{name = "ssh-userauth"}},
  744: 	   {match, #ssh_msg_service_accept{name = "ssh-userauth"}, receive_msg}
  745:           ], AfterKexState),
  746:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  747: 
  748: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  749: %%% The server sends the extension
  750: ext_info_s(Config) ->    
  751:     %% Start the daemon
  752:     Server = {Pid,_,_} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{send_ext_info,true},
  753:                                               {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}]),
  754:     {ok,AfterKexState} = connect_and_kex([{extra_options,[{recv_ext_info,true}]},
  755:                                           {server,Server}
  756:                                           | Config]),
  757:     {ok,_} =
  758:         ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  759:           [{match, #ssh_msg_ext_info{_='_'}, receive_msg}
  760:           ],
  761:           AfterKexState),
  762:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  763: 
  764: %%%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  765: %%% The client sends the extension
  766: ext_info_c(Config) ->    
  767:     %% Create a listening socket as server socket:
  768:     {ok,InitialState} = ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(listen),
  769:     HostPort = ssh_trpt_test_lib:server_host_port(InitialState),
  770: 
  771:     Parent = self(),
  772:     %% Start a process handling one connection on the server side:
  773:     Pid =
  774:         spawn_link(
  775:           fun() ->
  776:                   Result =
  777:                       ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  778:                         [{set_options, [print_ops, print_messages]},
  779:                          {accept, [{system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
  780:                                    {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  781:                                    {recv_ext_info, true}
  782:                                   ]},
  783:                          receive_hello,
  784:                          {send, hello},
  785:                          
  786:                          {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
  787:                          {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  788:                          
  789:                          {match, #ssh_msg_kexdh_init{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  790:                          {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_reply},
  791: 
  792:                          {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
  793:                          {match,  #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  794: 
  795:                          {match, #ssh_msg_ext_info{_='_'}, receive_msg},
  796: 
  797:                          close_socket,
  798:                          print_state
  799:                         ],
  800:                         InitialState),
  801:                   Parent ! {result,self(),Result}
  802:           end),
  803: 
  804:     %% connect to it with a regular Erlang SSH client
  805:     %% (expect error due to the close_socket in daemon):
  806:     {error,_} = std_connect(HostPort, Config, 
  807:                             [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  808:                                                     {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  809:                                                    ]},
  810:                              {tstflg, [{ext_info_client,true}]},
  811:                              {send_ext_info, true}
  812:                             ]
  813:                            ),
  814:     
  815:     %% Check that the daemon got expected result:
  816:     receive
  817:         {result, Pid, {ok,_}} -> ok;
  818:         {result, Pid, Error} -> ct:fail("Error: ~p",[Error])
  819:     end.
  820: 
  821: 
  822: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  823: %%%
  824: preferred_algorithms(Config) ->
  825:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  826:     {error,{eoptions,{{preferred_algorithms,{kex,[some_unknown_algo]}},
  827:                       "Unsupported value(s) found"}}} =
  828:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  829:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX],
  830:                       Ciphers,
  831:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  832:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  833:                                               ]}
  834:                       ]).
  835: 
  836: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  837: %%%
  838: modify_append(Config) ->
  839:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  840:     {ok,_} =
  841:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  842:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX, ?EXTRA_KEX],
  843:                       Ciphers,
  844:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  845:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  846:                                               ]},
  847:                        {modify_algorithms, [{append,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}]}]}
  848:                       ]).
  849: 
  850: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  851: %%%
  852: modify_prepend(Config) ->
  853:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  854:     {ok,_} =
  855:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  856:                       [?EXTRA_KEX, ?DEFAULT_KEX],
  857:                       Ciphers,
  858:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  859:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  860:                                               ]},
  861:                        {modify_algorithms, [{prepend,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}]}]}
  862:                       ]).
  863: 
  864: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  865: %%%
  866: modify_rm(Config) ->
  867:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  868:     {ok,_} =
  869:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  870:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX],
  871:                       tl(Ciphers),
  872:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX,?EXTRA_KEX]},
  873:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  874:                                               ]},
  875:                        {modify_algorithms, [{rm,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]},
  876:                                                  {cipher,[hd(Ciphers)]}
  877:                                                 ]}
  878:                                            ]}
  879:                       ]).
  880: 
  881: 
  882: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  883: %%%
  884: modify_combo(Config) ->
  885:     Ciphers = filter_supported(cipher, ?CIPHERS),
  886:     LastC = lists:last(Ciphers),
  887:     {ok,_} =
  888:         chk_pref_algs(Config,
  889:                       [?DEFAULT_KEX],
  890:                       [LastC] ++ (tl(Ciphers)--[LastC]) ++ [hd(Ciphers)],
  891:                       [{preferred_algorithms, [{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX,?EXTRA_KEX]},
  892:                                                {cipher,Ciphers}
  893:                                               ]},
  894:                        {modify_algorithms, [{rm,[{kex,[some_unknown_algo,?EXTRA_KEX]}
  895:                                                 ]},
  896:                                             {prepend,[{cipher,[{server2client,[LastC]}]}
  897:                                                      ]},
  898:                                             {append,[{cipher,[a,hd(Ciphers),b]}
  899:                                                     ]}
  900:                                            ]}
  901:                       ]).
  902: 
  903: 
  904: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  905: %%%
  906: client_close_after_hello(Config0) ->
  907:     MaxSessions = 20,
  908:     SleepSec = 15,
  909:     Config = start_std_daemon(Config0, [{parallel_login,true},
  910:                                         {max_sessions,MaxSessions},
  911:                                         {negotiation_timeout,SleepSec*1000}
  912:                                        ]),
  913: 
  914:     {_Parents0, Conns0, []} = find_handshake_parent(server_port(Config)),
  915: 
  916:     Cs =
  917:         [ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  918:            [{connect,
  919:              server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
  920:              [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
  921:                                      {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
  922:                                     ]},
  923:               {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  924:               {recv_ext_info, false},
  925:               {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  926:               {user_interaction, false}
  927:               | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
  928:              ]},
  929:             {send, hello}
  930:            ]) || _ <- lists:seq(1,MaxSessions+100)],
  931: 
  932:     ct:pal("=== Tried to start ~p sessions.", [length(Cs)]),
  933: 
  934:     ssh_info:print(fun ct:pal/2),
  935:     {Parents, Conns, Handshakers} = find_handshake_parent(server_port(Config)),
  936:     ct:pal("Found (Port=~p):~n"
  937:            "  Connections  (length ~p): ~p~n"
  938:            "  Handshakers  (length ~p): ~p~n"
  939:            "  with parents (length ~p): ~p",
  940:            [server_port(Config),
  941:             length(Conns), Conns,
  942:             length(Handshakers), Handshakers,
  943:             length(Parents), Parents]),
  944:     if
  945:         length(Handshakers)>0 ->
  946:             lists:foreach(fun(P) -> exit(P,some_reason) end, Parents),
  947:             ct:pal("After sending exits; now going to sleep", []),
  948:             timer:sleep((SleepSec+15)*1000),
  949:             ct:pal("After sleeping", []),
  950:             ssh_info:print(fun ct:pal/2),
  951:             {Parents2, Conns2, Handshakers2} = find_handshake_parent(server_port(Config)),
  952:             ct:pal("Found (Port=~p):~n"
  953:                    "  Connections  (length ~p): ~p~n"
  954:                    "  Handshakers  (length ~p): ~p~n"
  955:                    "  with parents (length ~p): ~p",
  956:                    [server_port(Config),
  957:                     length(Conns2), Conns2,
  958:                     length(Handshakers2), Handshakers2,
  959:                     length(Parents2), Parents2]),
  960:             if
  961:                 Handshakers2==[] andalso Conns2==Conns0 ->
  962:                     ok;
  963:                 Handshakers2=/=[] ->
  964:                     ct:pal("Handshakers still alive: ~p", [Handshakers2]),
  965:                     {fail, handshakers_alive};
  966:                 true ->
  967:                     ct:pal("Connections before: ~p~n"
  968:                            "Connections after: ~p", [Conns0,Conns2]),
  969:                     {fail, connections_bad}
  970:             end;
  971: 
  972:         true ->
  973:             {fail, no_handshakers}
  974:     end.
  975: 
  976: 
  977: %%%================================================================
  978: %%%==== Internal functions ========================================
  979: %%%================================================================
  980: 
  981: chk_pref_algs(Config,
  982:               ExpectedKex,
  983:               ExpectedCiphers,
  984:               ServerPrefOpts) ->
  985:     %% Start the daemon
  986:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(
  987:                       [{send_ext_info,false},
  988:                        {recv_ext_info,false},
  989:                        {system_dir, system_dir(Config)}
  990:                        | ServerPrefOpts])
  991:     of
  992:         {_,Host,Port} ->
  993:             %% Check the Kex part
  994:             ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
  995:               [{set_options, [print_ops, {print_messages,detail}]},
  996:                {connect, Host, Port,
  997:                 [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  998:                  {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
  999:                  {user_interaction, false}
 1000:                 ]},
 1001:                {send, hello},
 1002:                receive_hello,
 1003:                {match,
 1004:                 #ssh_msg_kexinit{
 1005:                    kex_algorithms = to_lists(ExpectedKex),
 1006:                    encryption_algorithms_server_to_client = to_lists(ExpectedCiphers),
 1007:                    _   = '_'},
 1008:                 receive_msg}
 1009:               ]);
 1010:         Error ->
 1011:             Error
 1012:     end.
 1013: 
 1014: 
 1015: filter_supported(K, Algs) -> Algs -- (Algs--supported(K)).
 1016: 
 1017: supported(_K) -> proplists:get_value(
 1018:                    server2client,
 1019:                    ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(cipher)).
 1020: 
 1021: to_lists(L) -> lists:map(fun erlang:atom_to_list/1, L).
 1022:     
 1023: 
 1024: %%%---- init_suite and end_suite ---------------------------------------	
 1025: start_apps(Config) ->
 1026:     catch ssh:stop(),
 1027:     ok = ssh:start(),
 1028:     Config.
 1029: 
 1030: stop_apps(_Config) ->
 1031:     ssh:stop().
 1032: 
 1033: 
 1034: setup_dirs(Config) ->
 1035:     ct:log("Pub keys setup for: ~p",
 1036:            [ssh_test_lib:setup_all_user_host_keys(Config)]),
 1037:     Config.
 1038: 
 1039: system_dir(Config) -> filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system).
 1040: 
 1041: user_dir(Config) -> proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config).
 1042: 
 1043: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1044: start_std_daemon(Config) ->	
 1045:     start_std_daemon(Config, []).
 1046: 
 1047: start_std_daemon(Config, ExtraOpts) ->
 1048:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), 
 1049:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1050:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1051:     UserPasswords = [{"user1","pwd1"}],
 1052:     Options = [%%{preferred_algorithms,[{public_key,['ssh-rsa']}]}, %% For some test cases
 1053: 	       {system_dir, system_dir(Config)},
 1054: 	       {user_dir, UserDir},
 1055: 	       {user_passwords, UserPasswords},
 1056: 	       {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}
 1057: 	       | ExtraOpts],
 1058:     Ref = {Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon(Options),
 1059:     ct:log("Std server ~p started at ~p:~p~nOptions=~p",[Server, Host, Port, Options]),
 1060:     [{server,Ref}, {user_passwords, UserPasswords} | Config].
 1061: 
 1062: 
 1063: stop_std_daemon(Config) ->
 1064:     ssh:stop_daemon(server_pid(Config)),
 1065:     ct:log("Std server ~p at ~p:~p stopped", [server_pid(Config), server_host(Config), server_port(Config)]),
 1066:     lists:keydelete(server, 1, Config).
 1067: 
 1068: 
 1069: check_std_daemon_works(Config, Line) ->
 1070:     case std_connect(Config) of
 1071: 	{ok,C} ->
 1072: 	    ct:log("Server ~p:~p ~p is ok at line ~p",
 1073: 		   [server_host(Config), server_port(Config), 
 1074: 		    server_pid(Config), Line]),
 1075: 	    ok = ssh:close(C),
 1076: 	    Config;
 1077: 	Error = {error,_} ->
 1078: 	    ct:fail("Standard server ~p:~p ~p is ill at line ~p: ~p",
 1079: 		    [server_host(Config), server_port(Config), 
 1080: 		     server_pid(Config), Line, Error])
 1081:     end.
 1082: 
 1083: server_pid(Config)  -> element(1,?v(server,Config)).
 1084: server_host(Config) -> element(2,?v(server,Config)).
 1085: server_port(Config) -> element(3,?v(server,Config)).
 1086: 
 1087: server_user_password(Config) -> server_user_password(1, Config).
 1088: 
 1089: server_user_password(N, Config) -> lists:nth(N, ?v(user_passwords,Config)).
 1090:     
 1091: 
 1092: std_connect(Config) -> 
 1093:     std_connect({server_host(Config), server_port(Config)}, Config).
 1094:     
 1095: std_connect({Host,Port}, Config) ->
 1096:     std_connect({Host,Port}, Config, []).
 1097: 
 1098: std_connect({Host,Port}, Config, Opts) ->
 1099:     std_connect(Host, Port, Config, Opts).
 1100: 
 1101: std_connect(Host, Port, Config, Opts) ->
 1102:     {User,Pwd} = server_user_password(Config),
 1103:     ssh:connect(Host, Port, 
 1104: 		%% Prefer User's Opts to the default opts
 1105: 		[O || O = {Tag,_} <- [{user,User},{password,Pwd},
 1106: 				      {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1107:                                       {save_accepted_host, false},
 1108: 				      {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1109: 				      {user_interaction, false}],
 1110: 		      not lists:keymember(Tag, 1, Opts)
 1111: 		] ++ Opts,
 1112: 		30000).
 1113:     
 1114: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------	
 1115: connect_and_kex(Config) ->
 1116:     connect_and_kex(Config, ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec([]) ).
 1117: 
 1118: connect_and_kex(Config, InitialState) ->
 1119:     ssh_trpt_test_lib:exec(
 1120:       [{connect,
 1121: 	server_host(Config),server_port(Config),
 1122: 	[{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[?DEFAULT_KEX]},
 1123:                                 {cipher,?DEFAULT_CIPHERS}
 1124:                                ]},
 1125:          {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1126:          {recv_ext_info, false},
 1127: 	 {user_dir, user_dir(Config)},
 1128: 	 {user_interaction, false}
 1129:          | proplists:get_value(extra_options,Config,[])
 1130:         ]},
 1131:        receive_hello,
 1132:        {send, hello},
 1133:        {send, ssh_msg_kexinit},
 1134:        {match, #ssh_msg_kexinit{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1135:        {send, ssh_msg_kexdh_init},
 1136:        {match,# ssh_msg_kexdh_reply{_='_'}, receive_msg},
 1137:        {send, #ssh_msg_newkeys{}},
 1138:        {match, #ssh_msg_newkeys{_='_'}, receive_msg}
 1139:       ],
 1140:       InitialState).
 1141: 
 1142: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1143: 
 1144: %%% For matching peer disconnection
 1145: disconnect() ->
 1146:     disconnect('_').
 1147: 
 1148: disconnect(Code) ->
 1149:     {'or',[#ssh_msg_disconnect{code = Code,
 1150: 			       _='_'},
 1151: 	   tcp_closed,
 1152: 	   {tcp_error,econnaborted}
 1153: 	  ]}.
 1154: 
 1155: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1156: find_handshake_parent(Port) ->
 1157:     Acc = {_Parents=[], _Connections=[], _Handshakers=[]},
 1158:     find_handshake_parent(supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup), Port, Acc).
 1159: 
 1160: 
 1161: find_handshake_parent([{{ssh_system_sup,{address,_,Port,_}},
 1162:                         Pid,supervisor, [ssh_system_sup]}|_],
 1163:                       Port, Acc) ->
 1164:     find_handshake_parent(supervisor:which_children(Pid), Port, Acc);
 1165: 
 1166: find_handshake_parent([{{ssh_acceptor_sup,{address,_,Port,_}},
 1167:                         PidS,supervisor,[ssh_acceptor_sup]}|T],
 1168:                        Port, {AccP,AccC,AccH}) ->
 1169:     GrandParents =
 1170:         [PidW ||
 1171:             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,{address,_,Port1,_}}, PidW, worker, [ssh_acceptor]} <-
 1172:                 supervisor:which_children(PidS),
 1173:             Port1 == Port],
 1174:     Parents =
 1175:         [PidPH || PidW <- GrandParents, PidPH <- element(2, process_info(PidW, links)), is_pid(PidPH)],
 1176:     Handshakers =
 1177:         [PidH || PidW <- Parents, PidH <- element(2, process_info(PidW, links)), is_pid(PidH),
 1178:             process_info(PidH,current_function) == {current_function,{ssh_connection_handler,handshake,3}}],
 1179:     find_handshake_parent(T, Port, {AccP++GrandParents, AccC, AccH++Handshakers});
 1180: 
 1181: find_handshake_parent([{_Ref,PidS,supervisor,[ssh_subsystem_sup]}|T], Port, {AccP,AccC,AccH}) ->
 1182:     Connections =
 1183:         [Pid || {connection,Pid,worker,[ssh_connection_handler]} <- supervisor:which_children(PidS)],
 1184:     find_handshake_parent(T, Port, {AccP, AccC++Connections, AccH});
 1185: 
 1186: find_handshake_parent([_|T], Port, Acc) ->
 1187:     find_handshake_parent(T, Port, Acc);
 1188: 
 1189: find_handshake_parent(_, _,  {AccP,AccC,AccH}) ->
 1190:     {lists:usort(AccP), lists:usort(AccC), lists:usort(AccH)}.
